name: Bich Duyen Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique hotel has definately been a highlight of our hotel stays in Asia. After reading the reviews on this website, I booked a 4 night stay, and we were not disappointed. Room on the 5th floor was worth the climb! Very clean. Breakfast was included in the price, and was lovely. The staff...especially the man at the front desk, were friendly and helpful in every way. A thoroughly enjoyable stay. Wish it could have been longer!!
reviews.title: Excellent. STAY HERE!!!

likes.liked: — the staff, the clean rooms, and the service in general

reviews.text: Booked a room for one night but room was only available at 5pm. Was offered a bigger room in the hotel opposite (under the same owner). Therefore, I can only review the service of the staff rather than the accommodation. Chanh the manager was super efficient, helpful and friendly. He gives the best tips on where to get the best noodles in the neighbourhood. He even cooks the eggs for breakfast! Talk about multi-tasking!
reviews.title: Excellent service from Chanh, the manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great little hotel for our first Vietnam experience. Booked via internet and then liased with Chanh the manager via email to arrange airport pick ups and anything else we needed. Its in a quiet location in a side alley in the heart of back packer central in HCMC. Great pho resuarant around the corner. Loved it so much, we are going back when we go back to HCMC at the end of October. Rooms are clean, bathrooms spotless and staff are very friendly. Great choice.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Excellent clean little hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. our en suite room had air-con (much needed), Fridge and TV, Room was cleaned everyday. The bloke that ran the place even stays up to the wee small hours to let you stumble back in. Quality. if you are on a budget and want more bang for your dong this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Excellent little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is 1 hotel that is clean and quiet. Tucked in an alley of the Pham Ngu Lao, it is quiet for a good nights sleep, yet not far from the hustle and bustle of the city life. Within walking distance to all major sights and the staff is friendly and helpful too. Great place for the amount that you pay!
reviews.title: Loved the cleanliness and proximity to everything going on in HCMC

reviews.text: bich duyen, kinda hard to find coz it is inside an alley not exactly along pham ngu lao street. but once u get there u will be greeted by a funny sounding local receptionist, very welcoming guy. a clean, posh reception area. and once you get to your room, like with us, i think its so beautifully made from furnitures, size of the room, room facilities, amazing! worth it! no wonder its always fully booked. It is close to many travel agencies, restaurants, market, souvenir shops.
reviews.title: nice hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Very comfortable place to stay

likes.liked: — Level of service, cleanliness, great air conditioning
likes.disliked: — Big pillows, steep stairs (although Chanh will carry your luggage!)

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Bich Duyen Hotel for two nights– the first night was in late April and the second night was in early May after a trip to Phu Quoc Island. We booked at Bich Duyen based on the positive feedback on Tripadvisor and the hotel definitely exceeded our expectations! We initially emailed to inquire about reservations and the manager, Chanh, was prompt, efficient, and helpful in his correspondence. We paid $16 per night for a standard room with a double bed and, while the room was small and basic, we found it to be quite comfortable with a private bathroom, refrigerator, fan, and air conditioning. Of all the places we stayed during our two week travels through Indochina, the Bich Duyen was the least expensive, yet was one of the most immaculate and had one of the best quality air conditioners (essential in April). We were also impressed by the number of amenities included in the reasonable price. Each floor has free wireless internet and there is a computer in the lobby with high speed internet for guest use until 10:30 PM. Free breakfast is provided from 7:00-10 and included a generous serving of eggs, bread, bananas, coffee or tea, and juice. The hotel also offers airport car service at a price of $12 from the airport and $8 returning to the airport, which we used during both of our stays and found to be reliable, convenient, and hassle-free (particularly given the number of illegitimate taxis we encountered in HCM City).
reviews.title: Watch those stairs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most noteworthy thing about the Bich Duyen Hotel was the service provided by Chanh prior to and during our stay. He is continually available to hotel guests and offers many services including tour booking, dinner reservations, postal services, visa arrangements to other countries, and general travel advice. Even though we were only there for two nights, he was continually willing to help us with a smile. For instance, he allowed us to have our tickets to Phu Quoc Island delivered to the hotel prior to the arrival, stored our luggage while we were traveling, and on our final day in HCM City, offered us a shower before our departure at 9:00 PM even though we’d checked out at noon.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise

reviews.text: In terms of potential areas for improvement, we found the pillows to be a bit too large and firm for our comfort. The steep, winding stairs were also fine for us, but might pose a concern for disabled or easily fatigued travelers. Additionally, noise within the public spaces of the building (e.g. the dining area, lobby, hallway and stairs) carries throughout the hotel; consequently, when breakfast begins around 7 AM loud guests can occasionally be heard from the bed rooms. That said, the hotel’s location in an alley in District 1 virtually eliminates noise from the street, despite the hotel’s convenient location in the heart of the city. We found the hotel to be much quieter than the hotel where we stayed in Hanoi.
reviews.title: Still Good Hotel at $25

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the BD Hotel on our last leg of our trip through VN. The staff here were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very basic but exactly what we expected and what was described when we booked it. The hotel is a backpacker's hotel but we have absolutely no complaints. The location was down a small, quiet side street across the street from a nice park and close to the huge Ben Thanh marketplace. If you’re looking for basic lodging at a good value with nice staff the BD Hotel is as good as any.
reviews.title: Nice Quiet, Basic Hotel/Good Location

reviews.text: Hi to all,
reviews.title: Everything Awesome!!
Wonderful hotel, Chanh is great.
reviews.text: Everyone has pretty much said it all. An awesome and inexspensive place to say, (stayed there 4 days ago).
Chanh is definitely 'the man' and he makes everything possible and easy. Great breakfast, all incredibly clean and in the backpackers area close to shops that we found FAR better than the markets.
reviews.title: Nice guesthouse

likes.disliked: — small room, noise from the stairs

reviews.title: Chanh "IS" the MAN!
reviews.text: We stayed in some really classy hotels in Vietnam (and fairly exspensive) but thought this guesthouse matched them easily overall

If not for this website's raving reviews, I'd have never booked this wonderful hotel due to it's dubious-looking location. It's amazing how Bich Duyen's reputation stood out from its peers along the same small alley when it doesn't look any much different in appearance from outside.
reviews.title: Patient Chanh

likes.liked: — Chanh, Cheap accomodation for its clean and comfortable room.

reviews.text: I wouldn't really call it a hotel, it's more like a nice homestay experience for me. The room is clean and cosy if you only turn on the yellow lights. Toilet is amazingly nice. There are lots of channels on the TV to choose from: Cinemax, Animal Planet, MTV, HBO.
reviews.title: Saigon's best value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I hated was the terrible stairs climbing. 7 of us went and we had 3 rooms situated on the 2nd, 3rd and 4th floors. The lobby would count as Ground level (not 1st), so staying on 2nd floor would mean climbing 4 flights of very steep, twirling high steps. I'd go out of breath everytime I climb to the 2nd floor, and muscle cramps when I reach the 4th floor. My friend had a terrible bruise on her shoulder from knocking into the side of the wall which had a wall jutting out into the already squeezy stairs. Met someone in the lobby who had a ankle bandage/cast and in clutches as he fell down the stairs. On the bright side, it is good exercise.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: I must thank Chanh and his brother for being so patient with us. We would go to the casino and return in the wee hours when they are asleep and have to open the gates for us and help us push our motorbikes into the lobby. Never once did he make a face or complained. Bich Duyen closes its gates quite early, around midnight, so it's not like regular hotels where you can leave and enter anytime in the wee hours.
reviews.title: So Far So Great
Our "go to" Saigon Hotel
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Bich Duyen for 6 nights in April this year (we got back 2 weeks ago). I would recommend this hotel to anyone - it was unbelievable value, exceptionally clean, in a great location, with excellent service.

I Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in early January 2008.I was picked up at the airport,arranged by e mail through the hotel,and had a fantastic stay at the hotel.The hotel is located in a small picturesque lane in the heart of the backpacker district,very quiet,but a 1 minute walk has you in the heart of the action.The hotel is small,clean and inexspensive and extremely friendly.The staff are the best i have experienced on my travels.Managed by a gentleman named Chanh,he is super efficient and nothing is a problem or hassle for him.Whether you require airline tickets,taxi,s,need trips booked,advice on where to go,he is your man.Thanks to Chanh and his staff for a great stay and this has to be the best value hotel i have stayed in.For a budget hotel in the heart of the city definately stay here....
reviews.title: Chanh Deserves A Medal

reviews.text: Great location, The staff are as friendly as they are hospitable... always willing to help with "the smile" that vietnam is known for. They are very helpful. Rooms are very clean and very comfortable. I definitely would recommend them to anyone travelling to Ho Chi Minh.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are in our 60s, and were on our first visit to Vietnam. Our hotel/hostel requirements were basic: inexpensive, reasonably clean, central and private bath. A web search showed Bich Duyen had good reviews. It much surpassed our expectations, giving us what we consider luxury during travel: fantastically clean; consistent hot water; good breakfast included; air conditioning (which we mostly didn't need); colour TV (which we didn't have time to watch); a good-sized room and bath; free internet access; and soft toilet paper. They arranged to get us from the airport at midnight, and transportation back to the airport another midnight. Chanh, the manager, is available virtually 24 hours/day and is always most friendly, fun and helpful for any request. Other staff are equally wonderful. One note: If you're a person who needs thick luxury towels, bring your own. But the ones here do the job just fine.
reviews.title: Terrific accommodation

likes.liked: — price, cleanliness, breakfast, great staff, central

reviews.title: Bich Duyen, a good place to stay
reviews.text: Were we to return to Ho Chi Minh City, this is where we would stay again.

Our family visited Vietnam in the first half of December and we booked our first two nights in Bich Duyen, intending to book further nights if we liked it. We booked all our remaining nights in HCMC there too! (although by leaving it until then, we had to spend one night across the alleyway, which is OK but not quite as good). Chanh is effusive ( you'll see) and marvellously obliging, the accommodation is clean, most comfortable, well situated and cheap. The welcoming juice on arrival is a nice touch. Breakfasts are eggs, juice, bread & a beverage and are just fine. All in all, we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Super helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed there in May found the place was really clean and the manager Chann really helpfull.
reviews.title: great place great people

reviews.text: The location was great as every thing within walking distance I would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Chanh is the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chanh is the best Hotel Manager in the World. I've stayed in three-star and five-star hotels and I have not met a hotel manager better than Mr. Chanh.
reviews.title: Bich Duyen Hotel, Pham Ngu Lao, District 1, HCMC

likes.liked: — Price, Cleanliness, Service, Security and Location

reviews.title: Love it! Chanh is the best
reviews.text: Good Service is definitely Chanh's middle name! He makes sure that everything in his hotel is clean and he makes sure his clients are very comfortable, even if this means doing things beyond the call of duty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bich Duyen is highly-recommended! The hotel is very clean, and Chanh will make sure that your stay in his hotel and in his country is without hassle.
reviews.title: Thanks Trip Advisor

description: Bich Duyen hotel is located in the heart of the Backpacker area, quiet, clean air, 5 minutes walk to Ben Thanh market, tour booking, shop, bank, park etc. all within walking distance. We serve free breakfast, tea, coffee, pineapple juice and we have high speed internet. Reception staff warmly welcome guests like family and will give you advice about anything you want to know about Vietnam.
